result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing 9/12/2014.

*****10-2-14 Judge Konkol, Court ordered restitution to Tenaya A as follows : $3721.70 for birthing costs and $2,000 for child rearing costs for a total of $5,721.70 to be paid to Tenaya A. Court approved the stipulation. Victim should be paid first from the bond monies, then costs should be paid. DOC to collect any sum/amounts at the rate of 25% from wages/funds. Any amounts unpaid when defendant is released on extended supervision should be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Any amounts unpaid at the end of extended supervision should be reduced to civil judgment and subject to other collection ****

Pay applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge and assessments.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek/maintain fulltime employment unless SSI prohibits, then part time or as determined.
Obtain GED/HSED.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication.

No futher violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
No use or pssession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
NO contact with the victim, her mother or the victim's child; contact with child may be modifed to supervised contact if the defendant complies with all conditions of Extended supervision and petititions Family Court and is current with child support.
No contact with children under the age of 16 without consent of DOC.   Supervised contact with his own children only if the defendant complies with Family Court Order and the defendant is paying child support and current.

Successfully complete an anger management and domestic violence course.
Attend parenting class while in custody and attend additonal course while on Extended supervision.
Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Register and comply with the sex offender registry.  Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession; voting and child sex offender working with children.

Case heard by Judge Rosa, Branch 35 for Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24:
Defendant Brandon A Jones in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Brandon A Jones in custody. Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for competency hearing.  Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Collins's report.  Defense does challenge report.  Court qualified Dr.  to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Deborah Collins.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.
After review of all evidence, report, and testimony of Dr. Collins, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent.  Court found the defendant is not competent to refuse psychotropic medication or treatment due to mental illness because the defendant is incapable of expressing an understanding of the advantages and disadvantages of accepting psychotropic medication or treatment. Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  
The Department of Health and Family Services is authorized to administer psychotropic medication or treatment to the defendant, and shall observe appropriate medical standards.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report on 8/10/2020 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 10, 2020 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court via zoom conference, defendant Brandon A Jones not in court, in custody at MSDF.  Alicia H Kort appeared on behalf of Erin Karshen for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Borowski in Court 8000 on behalf of Branch 24. Adjourned hearing held. Matter originally in court for contested competency hearing. All parties ready to proceed. Defendant NOT able to be produced via video conference at MSDF due to time contraints. Competency hearing rescheduled.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 8, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Brandon A Jones in court with attorney Fred Richardson telephonically.  Defendant Brandon A Jones in custody via video conference.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Feiss in Court 8000 on behalf of branch 24. All parties have received the report. Defendant DOES contest the findings and requests a competency hearing. Doctor Collins available for telephone testimony at next date.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 22, 2020 at 10:00 am.

Case heard by Judge Rosa, Branch 35 for Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24:

Case in court for return on doctor's report. Defense counsel has not reviewed the report with the defendant and requests an adjournment. State does not object. Court grants request. Court approves request for competency evaluation report due date to be extended to April 20, 2020.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Brandon A Jones not in court, in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is advised by the Administrative Law Judge there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Order for Examination, signed and filed. Case adjourned to Br. 24.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 6, 2020 at 01:30 pm.

NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO WITHDRAW. AJ

Court of Appeals order dated June 16, 2015, Appeal 2014XX1716CR, Attorney Daniel P. Murray shall remain counsel of record for Jones. Murray must move the circuit court for permission to withdraw so that the circuit court can ensure that Jones is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waiving the right to counsel by deciding to terminate Murray's services. Attorney Murray shall file a motion to withdraw no later than ten days from the date of this order. The deadline to file a post-conviction motion or notice of appeal is extended sixty days after the date the circuit court decides Attorney Murray's motion to withdraw.

Defendant Brandon A Jones in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Brandon A Jones in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Brandon A Jones in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Brandon A Jones in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 12. Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed the offer on the record.
Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Defense counsel made a motion to modify conditions of bail. Court requested defense counsel submit a motion to Branch 12 on this matter as Branch 12 is court of record. 
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody. Case adjourned to Branch 12.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Court ordered the defendant post an additional $50,000 (defendant previously posted $10,000).

Defendant Brandon A Jones in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
